channel.title: File Extention question + Ipod question
channel.description:
ok well on computers you know how they have like .jpg and .html and .scar ...etc.. well on my computer i cant see the file extensions i just see the name of the file.. well it dident bother me until today when i was trying to change somthing
well my 2 questions are this
1. how can i make it so i can see the extensions
2. ok i want to put a Movie File on my Video Ipod, how can i do this? cuz its says incorrect format...

item.title: File Extention question + Ipod question
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

i want video only on my video, i also want this for my normal Ipod.

Read full topic

item.title: File Extention question + Ipod question
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

.m4a and .mp4 are both MPEG-4 files - m4a typically is used for audio though, so if you have a video, you’re find with mp4.

Read full topic

item.title: File Extention question + Ipod question
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

ok thanks both of you, ill google the Ipod thing.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 08, 2007, 04:01:23 PM[/size][hr]uhhg, ok i got the converter but i need it to convert to .m4a it keeps converting to .mp4 why is this?!

Read full topic

item.description:
@solemage2 wrote:

Hey Dude, FOr the movie part, you need to convert it
For my Ipod I use
ImTOO iPod Movie Converter 3

I think I needed a serial for it. you can find one but it works good. it converts the movies that are compatable just for the Ipod

item.title: File Extention question + Ipod question
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Go on start menu > run > explorer > tools > folder options > view > uncheck hide known file extensions

Read full topic
